question: What this place needs is a good natural catastrophe. Earthquake, tornado...
answer: You gotta put the mustard underneath first.

question: Maybe a flood, like in the Bible.
answer: Here, let me do it. Come on... onion. Don't cheap out on me. Lotta onions.

question: Heyyy -- it's the Elly monster.
answer: How do you ride that thing on a wet street?

question: How do you ride that thing on a wet street?
answer: Talent. Hi.

question: Care for a hot dog?
answer: You buying?

question: I'm buying.
answer: No onions though, okay?

question: No onions?
answer: They make you fart.

question: They make you fart.
answer: What's goin' on, Elly?

question: I went to see a friend of mine.
answer: Well, how's your friend?

question: Uncle T-Bird's 100-proof accelerator. I squirt you with this, you could jump in the Detroit river and burn all the way to the bottom. You know, Lake Erie actually caught on fire once, from all the crap in it. Wish I coulda seen that. We're ready to rock.
answer: What about working girl?

question: What about her?
answer: I say we leave her here to fry, man.

question: No. Let's take her with us.
answer: Whoaaa -- T-Bird, red light, red light!

question: Blow yourself, bigmouth.
answer: Whoa, hey, whoa. Business.

question: Whatcha got?
answer: Coupla more rings... 24k.

question: 18k. Crap.
answer: ...necklace... pearls...

question: Nineteen bucks at Sears. Fake,
answer: Leather purse...

question: What's this -- a little, ah, bloodstain, right? Fifty bucks for the box, and I'm doin' you a --
answer: Yeah, I know, fatso. Do us all a favor. Make Top Dollar smile.

question: All right. Gotcha. Thanks.
answer: Not "your welcome", but other-worldly patience. It waits.

question: Where're we going next -- the sewer?
answer: It just blinks at him.

question: We have company.
answer: Having fun yet? No? I'll give you a hint. Remember whatshername?

question: Shelly?
answer: Miss her?

question: Yes.
answer: Kill the men who killed you both, and the Day of the Dead will be your reunion. You must use your eyes.

question: I guess I'm not ready to leave... just yet. The last time we saw each other, I didn't do so well. Huh, Gabriel? I bet you need some cat food... right?
answer: Three hundred and your a gunslinger. Ratty -- shut the fuck up.

question: Another satisfied customer?
answer: Who the hell is that? Come on out man, I won't hurt you.

question: Hello, Tin-Tin.
answer: Little early from trick-or-treat, homie. This dick trying to bushwack me.

question: Murderer.
answer: Guess you got that goddamn right.

question: Try harder. Try again. A year ago. Halloween. A man and a woman. In a loft. You helped to murder them.
answer: Last Halloween, eh? Yeah... Yeah, I remember. I fucked her too, I think.

question: You cut her. You raped her. You watched!
answer: Hey, I got my rocks off, so fuck you in the ass, man.

question: I want you to tell me a story, Tin-Tin.
answer: I don't know you... Holy shit... you're dead, man...

question: Couldn't have happened to a nicer couple.
answer: Sure it coulda. Funboy's not here, neither is T-Bird -- none of Top Dollar's number ones.

question: You know, you sure got a hard-on for a guy that's guilty of zip on paper. Top Dollar runs Showtime; what's the matter, don't you like adult entertainment?
answer: This sack of shit is called Tin- Tin.

question: Don't any of your little pals have real, grown up names?
answer: He was a runner for Top Dollar. Just muscle.

question: Was.
answer: This isn't Top Dollar's style anyway. This was somebody else. Somebody new.

question: And you're gonna tell me who.
answer: Who ever made that.

question: What in the hell... do you call that?
answer: I call it blood, Detective. If you want, you can call it graffiti.

question: Piss off, we're closed. Fucking creatures of the night; they never goddamn learn. HEY!!
answer: "Suddenly I heard a tapping, as of someone gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door." You heard me rapping, right?

question: Oh, bullshit! You're trespassing asshole, you're breakin' and enterin' and you just bought me a fucking door!
answer: I'm looking for something in an engagement ring. Gold.

question: You're looking for a coroner,shit- for-brains!
answer: I repeat Cute nickname, don't you think?

question: I ain't got no fuckin' ring.
answer: Wrong answer.

question: All's I got is in a box! Behind the counter!
answer: No... no... no... no... Tin-Tin confided in me, before he ran out of breath. You have one chance to live.

question: No fucking way. He'll kill me.
answer: Who would waste time killing you... besides me?

question: Top Dollar.
answer: Another jolly nickname?

question: You want those assholes, you want Top Dollar.
answer: T-Bird?

question: Like the car. He hangs out with Skank. that little ass-hair, and they hang at the Pit -- hell, Funboy lives there. Ask Top Dollar.
answer: A whole club of pirates, with pirate names... You feed off the living.

question: You walk outta here Top Dollar will erase your ass! Top Dollar owns the fucking street here and you can't dick with me, you son of a bitch!
answer: One chance to live. Take it.

question: One chance to live. Take it.
answer: Don't move! I said don't move.

question: I thought the police always said "freeze:.
answer: I'm the police and I say don't move, Snow White. You're under arrest; I don't care what else is wrong with you! You move and you're dead.

question: And I say I'm dead... and I move.
answer: No further. I'm serious.

question: Then shoot, if you will.
answer: Are you nuts, walking into a gun?

question: You must listen carefully
answer: You wanna run that back for me one time?

question: Listen
answer: You don't say.

question: I know Top Dollar has turned your streets into his hell.
answer: Fucking A, my friend.

question: The others are called Skank, T- Bird. Street names. Funboy. Watch me, office Albrecht.
answer: Watch it... You're the one who did Tin-Tin... Great. Good night. Guy shows up looking like a mime from hell. Least he didn't do that "walking against the wind" shit; I hate that.

question: Business.
answer: Wild fucking night. I hear our pal Tin-Tin got himself very dead.

question: And Gideon's just burned all the down to the foundation. I didn't have nothin to do with that.
answer: Bet that pisses you off, right?

question: Top, what the fuck is going on tonight?
answer: Stay normal, T. Cops'll be all hotwired and aggressive. No combat moves until I check this out.

question: What are you supposed to be? A clown?
answer: Sometimes.

question: You look like a rock star without a job.
answer: I dabble. May I?

question: I thought Halloween was tomorrow night. Get outta my way, you mooks.
answer: An unexpected pleasure.

question: Bad news. Alot of action on the streets tonight, and nobody bothered to clear it with me. Tin- Tin got himself whacked.
answer: Who got himself what?

question: One of mine. And it wasn't a standard hit.
answer: I had heard something like this. Describe it for me. The "hit".

question: I was wondering if you could tell me anything... about a wildcat operative.
answer: I know of no one. But even if there is, I am sure it is nothing outside your capacity to deal with?

question: Anybody violates my turf -- our turf -- I'll rip out there heart and show it to 'em.
answer: To be sure. Now tell how your friend died.

question: Annie?
answer: Whatever it is, the answer's no, Eddie. I'm too busy tonight.

question: Annie, I need a file.
answer: Speak up. Clear it with the Captain if you need a file.

question: This is special, darlin'. Please?
answer: Just don't tell me you "owe me one." What file?

question: My mom works over there. I'm waiting for her, but she's probably with him, right now.
answer: Who?

question: Mister Funboy.
answer: Mister Funboy lives there?

question: He has a room, upstairs. I don't like him very much. Can you play that thing or do you just carry it around everywhere?
answer: I can pick out a tune now and again.

question: Can you play "Teddy Bears' Picnic?" It used to be her favorite.
answer: Does she have a name?

question: No name. You sure ask a lot of questions. Hel-lo? Earth to anybody...? Do you feel okay.
answer: No.

question: You gotta go now, I bet.
answer: I have to go.

question: Don't thank me. Your ass is already in enough trouble for this shit.
answer: I knew that. Another nice white girl with a cause. Like a big KICK ME sign. Shelly Webster. And her nice white boyfriend, Eric Draven.

question: Your last little wild goose chase got you busted back to the Beat Patrol, just like in a bad detective story, Eddie. Are we doing the wildgoose thing again?
answer: Could be.

question: You gonna wind up working at a school crosswalk. that doughnut's chocolate you, know.
answer: Well, hello there...chocolate,

question: Don't thank me.
answer: Thanks, babe.

question: Oh wow, oh wow, don't fucking do that, man. I nearly had a fucking heart attack.
answer: Fun -- look at that guy...

question: It's just the dope, don't worry
answer: Fun, he's not going away; he's scaring the piss outta me!

question: Bull's eye. Good shot. Stay. Morphine is bad for you.
answer: How the hell did you do that?

question: Magic.
answer: Either die or do a solo.

question: Neither.
answer: Yeah, I got a more fun idea myself. I hate trespassers! I hate prowlers! I hate peeping toms! And right now I hate you! Ahh, the hell with it, I still got five shots left. Owwwaaaa -- fuck me! Look what you did to my sheets, you lame piece'a shit! AAAAaa! Goddd!

question: Does it hurt?
answer: Does it hurt?! You dead-ass, clown-faced fuck, of course it fucking hurts! What the shit are you gonna do about this?!

question: I have some pain killer right here.
answer: No, wait, no WAIT, that's too much, man, that's like overkill, nobody can take that much, you're wasting it -- !

question: Your pain ends now.
answer: Howdy You look a mess. Like an ole cooter dog. Getting a little ambitious and extracurricular, aren't we?

question: Go away.
answer: You need to learn to mind your own business or you'll never get where you think you're going.

question: Shut up.
answer: Maybe I was wrong about you.

question: Freeze.
answer: Jeezus! Don't ever do that, man! I told you cops don't say "freeze". You, my friend, are dead. I saw your body. You got buried.

question: I saw it, too. Walk with me.
answer: You died, man. I can't believe it but here you are. Last year, you and your girlfriend --

question: I need you to tell me what you remember. What happened to us?
answer: You went out the window. She was beaten and raped. She died in the hospital. Hey, you asked, man. She held on for thirty hours in intensive care. Hemorrhage, trauma. He body just finally gave it up. I saw it and couldn't do jack for her. You okay, man? I mean, what just happened.

question: The venom of bad memories. You were there; you saw her. I saw you seeing her.
answer: You gotta understand -- I was hoping she'd talk, give me a lead, a clue, something to work with. But she only said one thing to me before she died.

question: My name.
answer: I'm sorry as hell, man.

question: Thirty hours. A day of life, plus change... Halloween is coming, soon. You will have Top Dollar if you watch for me at the Showtime, tomorrow night.
answer: I should be trying to stop you.

question: Thank you. For giving a damn.
answer: My pleasure.

question: Don't smoke these.
answer: Damn, I wish he wouldn't do that.

question: Faster, T-Bird. Faster. You're a hell of a wheelman; you know you can drive faster.
answer: You call it, blood -- you got the gun. You just tell me where you want to go.

question: That's good. We're going someplace you've never been before. You caught one. Drive faster.
answer: Man, you gonna get us killed dead and I don't even know what you want!

question: I want you to stop talking. And drive. Drive faster. You're very popular. Thought you could handle this thing.
answer: To hell with you.

question: Naturally.
answer: So what -- you gonna rape me now?

question: You're Elly, right? I know your mom.
answer: A lot of people "know" my mom.

question: I know your friend, too -- the one that looks like a rock star.
answer: I don't know you.

question: I'd like to get in touch with him.
answer: You're not a cop, either. What do you want him for?

question: I'm looking for a good guitar man.
answer: Right. You buying? He kinda wanders around. You'll see him if you pay attention.

question: Hey, you little fuckweed! That's against the law! I don't give a shit what kinda bird this guy is.
answer: I am sitting over here. Do you think this childish machismo impresses me? When I was a boy in Saigon I watched my country change one block at a time, one building at a time. Whole lives erased. A way of life, polluted. Today, no one forces me to move. I use my powers to change your country, one block at a time, one building at a time.

question: Nice speech. What's it supposed to mean?
answer: Your comprehension is not required. Your cooperation and, indeed, your ability are the issues on the table.

question: Whatever you say, I can do.
answer: That's reassuring.

question: Top Dollar, you're the only one here still wasting good air...
answer: Five large, in the drawer right over there. I never saw you.

question: Do you know what you destroyed?
answer: Take the dope, too.

question: A year ago. A very nice lady circulated a petition. She died. Last Halloween. Answer yes or no.
answer: That's ancient history.

question: It's yesterday! Do you know what you destroyed?
answer: Who gives a fuck! I'm a businessman. You gonna do me, then do me and shut you're face!

question: You don't even remember...
answer: I never forget anything, dickhead. That building was a sweep-and- clear; the bitch was a nuisance with her goddamned petition. It got a little rowdy... end of story.

question: Come on! Keep your head down! I figured you might need a ride home.
answer: It's done.

question: I figured as much. Did you cap off Funboy.
answer: Funboy had to leave this mortal coil.

question: Yeah, among others. Hey, man -- you're hit.
answer: It's only a flesh wound.

question: It's only fourteen or fifteen flesh wounds.
answer: You shouldn't smoke these.

question: Great. Litterbug of the Living Dead.
answer: I'm finished. I mean, I've done what I came to do. It shouldn't hurt this much. But it will pass...

question: Right. You sure I can't just take you to the emergency ward?
answer: They couldn't do anything for me.

question: How 'bout the morgue?
answer: No. I have one more thing to do.

question: You're gonna kill somebody else. We're gonna stop and get a shit-load of Band-Aids?
answer: I have to prepare for an anniversary. This coming night.

question: What... the hell is that?
answer: This is a cobra, Mr. Grange. Yes, it is real.

question: That thing is poisonous.
answer: Extremely so. You and I are the recipients of unwanted good fortune, in the form of a man everyone is calling The Crow.

question: Give me a break. That guy's a wacko...
answer: I intend no slight to you, but I cannot find the English to adequately express just what he is. I suppose Western mythology would describe him as a Fury.

question: Not a Plymouth Fury, I bet.
answer: Do you know of spirit assassins? You do know the dead can rise? Properly motivated, of course.

question: Like some sort of zombie on a revenge trip.
answer: Mmm. But tonight I can take what is his.

question: Only thing you'll get from that clown is a faster way to die.
answer: To the contrary... ...all the dying tonight will be done by the former Eric Draven. Who is only invulnerable so long as he cares about the dead. When he begins to care about the living, you'll find his heart can bleed... and I want it to bleed for me.

question: Kill a dead guy?
answer: Truly kill him. So I may crush his skull and smoke it. Let it suffice that I need him... and to get to him, we'll need his little friend.

question: What's going on...?
answer: A remembrance. A closure. Better now. I feel good. How are you, Elly, my friend? What is it?

question: I knew. I knew I knew you. Even with the makeup and stuff you wore. You really loved her, didn't you?
answer: You brought flowers. As long as you don't forget her, Elly, she lives.

question: She's dead. She's gone. And now you're just gonna go away and never come back, too. I hate this place; it isn't fair.
answer: Elly... Sometimes the people we care about are gone, for no reason. Sometimes that's really tough. I cry. But if the people we love are gone, we keep them -- -- right here. It's a big responsibility. And that makes it okay to mourn. I know that if you weren't here, I'd be very sad.

question: You look funny without your white face on. Like it's your day off or something.
answer: Somebody here wants to meet you. Gabriel?

question: I remember him! Here, Gabriel... here kitty... Gabriel... Is he still yours?
answer: I think he's yours, now. I have something else for you.

question: Nobody ever gave me something like that before. Ever.
answer: Shelly would've wanted you to have it. This way, you'll think of her every time you see it...

question: If she opens her face again, shoot her in the head.
answer: Mom -- !

question: You should listen to your mother. She said no cats.
answer: Gabriel!

question: Stop screwing around. Your job is done. You interfere with the living again.
answer: Tell me I'll get hurt. That I might die. I've already done that. I don't need anyone's help. Yours included.

question: Do this thing and you will be vulnerable. The blood will not return. No powers. No reunion. Nothing.
answer: Fine with me.

question: You'll be alone.
answer: I'm already alone.

question: I wish to possess what you have now.
answer: I want the girl. Unharmed. Now.

question: I know. That is why I will prevail. Mr. Grange... ? Sooner or later, my action were destined to bring me a genuine Fury. And it turned out to be you. At last. I appreciate your abilities as few mortals can. That's why I desire them.
answer: You're too late. There was a guy outside - on the stairs - you really need to talk to. But he turned to dust and blew away. I don't have any power for you to take.

question: You sorta looked like you might need my help.
answer: This isn't your place. This isn't your fight. And I don't need your help.

question: You're welcome.
answer: Leave here. Don't do this. I don't want you here.

question: The hell you say. This isn't just about you any more.
answer: Don't interfere.

question: You're bleeding, man. You can't make it. You won't mind if I just take the stairs, then, smartass...
answer: Here I am.

question: Can you fly, Crow man?
answer: I ain't cut out for this superhero shit.

question: Face me!
answer: Is he dead yet?

question: And how many lives have you destroyed?
answer: I took yours from you. Your little girlfriend? I took hers, too. Your meaningless, petty life? I took it so that tonight your existence might gain a purpose. You're no avenger. You're mine.

question: You're right, I'm not an avenger. Not any more. Time for a sacrifice.
answer: I don't need eyes to take what I want from you.

question: Can you fly?
answer: Don't let me fall! Now do you get to see her? Shelly, I mean.

question: In a better place. I hope.
answer: You're not gonna come back, are you?

question: I don't know if I can. But you have this... and you know where to come.
answer: You mean you'll, like' dig your way out of the grave? Euww.
